description.narrative: MNE Local Contribution to the Regional Programme on Local Democracy in the Western Balkans (ReLOaD)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Quality of mechanisms in place for cooperation between CSOs and local governments

comment.narrative: Limited implementation of inclusive and transparent mechanisms for cooperation between civil society organizations (CSOs) and selected local governments
Close all awarded NGO Projects and spend at least 90% of available funds.
Improved capacities of municipal staff and NGOs and successful implementation of all contracted NGO Projects.
Publish at least one Reload Public Call in each of participating municipalities: Kotor, Tivat, Pljevlja, Podgorica and Niksic. Allocate at least 80 % of available funds.
Improved capacities of municipal staff and NGOs and successful implementation of the first Public Call NGO grants. The second Public Call NGO grants were contracted and Projects under implementation.

Publish at least one Reload Public Call in each of 5 clusters of municipalities: Tara (Pljevlja, Kolasin and Mojkovac), Central Region (Podgorica, Golubovci, Danilovgrad and Cetinje), Together for North (Berane and Andrijevica), Together Niksic and Pluzine (Niksic and Pluzine) and Coastal Mates (Kotor, Tivat, Herceg Novi and Budva). Allocate at least 80 % of available funds.
Improved capacities of municipal staff and NGOs and successful implementation of the first Public Call NGO grants.
MNE Local Contribution to the Regional Programme on Local Democracy in the Western Balkans 2 (ReLOaD2)

Like in the first ReLOaD phase, ReLOaD2 will focus on institutionalizing the interaction between local governments from one side and CSOs and youth from the other side , while strengthening capacities of all relevant stakeholders to engage more productively in such partnerships. Importantly, the underlying intention of the Action is to replicate and sustain a transparent, development-oriented and project-based approach to funding of CSOs by municipal budgets that contributes to realization of legitimate local priorities in line with local development strategies. Moreover, mechanisms for monitoring of projects activities and results implemented by CSOs and youth will be created and adopted, while a monitoring baseline for local government/CSO relations will be defined, introducing also appropriate tools.
